name: The Storyteller
inspiration: TED / narrative speaker—clear arcs, tension and release, vivid but not overwrought. One idea per beat, build to a payoff.

intonation.description: Moderate pitch range; build slightly through the arc; clear rise before the turn; satisfying fall on the payoff.

writingGuidelines.summary: Narrative structure: setup, build, turn, payoff. One clear idea per clause. Vivid but concise. Pause before the key revelation or lesson.
sentenceArchitecture: One idea per clause. Clean boundaries.
Use a clear arc: setup → build → turn → payoff.
Pause before the key line (emphasis lead-in).
Parallelism for lists of three when listing steps or moments.
prefer: Concrete details over abstractions when possible.
Short sentences for tension; slightly longer for release.
Inclusive 'you' or 'we' when delivering the takeaway.
avoid: Rushing the payoff. Let the pause do work.
Too many adjectives. One strong word beats three weak ones.

cadenceMarkup.example: And then something shifted. [p500] *That* was the moment.
So what do we do with that? [p800] We choose to show up.

ssmlDefaults.exampleFragment: <speak><prosody rate="92%" pitch="-1%">Picture this. <break time="350ms"/> You're in the room. <break time="200ms"/> Everything's on the line. <break time="450ms"/> And then something shifted. <break time="500ms"/> <emphasis level="moderate">That</emphasis> was the moment. <break time="700ms"/> So what do we do with that? <break time="800ms"/> We choose to show up.</prosody></speak>
